account_details.title: Account Details
account_details.description: Manage your profile details, account preferences, account security and privacy.

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.timeout_desc: Automatically locks the app after a chosen period of device inactivity.
preferences.timeout_action_lock_desc: A locked vault requires that you re-enter your master password to access it again.
preferences.timeout_action_logout_desc: A logged out vault requires that you re-authenticate to access it again.

danger_zone.title: Danger zone
danger_zone.delete_data_desc: Delete all data in your Locker account. Your Locker account still remains.

drag_upload.description: file to this area to upload

drag_upload.large: File size is very large! Please select file has size 800x400px

2fa.title: Setup Two Factor Authentication
2fa.description: After entering your password, you’ll be asked for a second authentication step.
2fa.name: App Authentication
2fa.name_description: Keep your account extra secure with a second login step.
2fa.enter_code: Enter the code that was generated here

step1.title: Download Locker Password Manager
step1.description: Download the Locker Password Manager app for your mobile phone, desktop computer, or install it in your browser extension.

step2.title: Write down this following key
step2.description: Write down this key <key>{{key}}</key> on the paper and store it safe in Locker note. You will need it if you lose or change your device.

step3.title: Go to OTP tab in Locker Password Manager app
step3.description: Open the Locker Password Manager app and navigate to the OTP tab. Scan QR barcode revealed below with the Locker App.

step4.title: Enter Authentication code
step4.description: The Authentication code given by your Locker app in the box.

email_setting.title: Email Settings
email_setting.description: Integrate with an Email service Provider to enable email notifications for your group members.

email_provider.title: Email Provider
email_provider.description: Choose an Email Provider that you want to use for email sending.

general.from_email_placeholder: Default address that emails will be sent from
general.from_name_placeholder: Default name that emails will be sent from

smtp.title: SMTP
smtp.description: The SMTP Credentials will be stored in your database. A few important expectations about your server:
smtp.description2: It must support TLS 1.0 or higher
smtp.note: Need help to integrate with SMTP?
smtp.port_description: Common ports for SMTP transmission are 25, 465, 587.

send_test.title: Send test email
send_test.description: Enter an email address to send a test email to

reset.title: Reset Email Plugin?
reset.description: Are you sure to reset? All changes you have made will be reset and your users will no longer receive emails.

lock.title: Sign in to your account
lock.description: Enter your Master Password to unlock

create_master_password.title: Create Master Password
create_master_password.description: The Master Password is the key to unlock your Locker. This is the only password you need to remember to access all other passwords stored in the Locker. Please do not share this password with anyone.
create_master_password.note: CyStack cannot view, cannot store, nor can it recover your Master Password in case you forget or lose it.

vault.title: Let's get started!
vault.description: Add your first item. You will find it here whenever you need it.

identity.title: Fill online forms faster
identity.description: Add Identity card so that Locker can autofill online forms on behalf of you.

crypto_backup.title: Add your first crypto backup
crypto_backup.description: Keep your crypto account/wallet in safe place.

card.title: Simplify online shopping
card.description: Add payment card to autofill when shopping online.

note.title: Free up your memory
note.description: Save Wi-Fi codes, office security alarm codes or your friends birthdays...

password.title: Let's get started!
password.description: Add your passwords and access them on any device, anytime.

authenticator.title: Secure your account
authenticator.description: Add an additional layer of security for your online accounts by setting up two-factor authentication with Locker.

folders.title: Add your first folder
folders.description: Add an folder to manage ciphers.

trash.title: There are no items to list.
trash.description: All items that are moved to the Trash can be restored until you permanently delete them

move_to.title: Move to
move_to.description: Choose a folder that you would like to move the {{amount}} selected item(s) to.

cipher.delete_question: Do you really want to send to the trash? Trash items will be permanently deleted after 30 days.
cipher.restore_question: Are you sure you want to restore this item?
cipher.permanently_delete_question: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this item?

password.title: Login Information
password.existing_otp: Set up from an existing OTP

shares.leave_question: Are you sure you want to leave this share group?

no_data.title: There are no items to list.
no_data.description: Items shared between you and others will appear here
no_data.quick_share_description: Send a link of the item to anyone, they don't need a Locker account to view it.

quick_shares.email_addresses_share: Email addresses for the people to share this with
quick_shares.email_addresses_share_note: They'll need to verify their email before they can access the item
quick_shares.expiration_description: This item's share link expires on {{time}}

new_share.in_app_share_items_note: Share with Locker users or group of Locker users (only for Locker business). They can view or edit your item.
new_share.in_app_share_folder_note: Share with Locker users (only for Locker business). They can view or edit your folder.
new_share.get_shareable_link_note: Send a link of the item to anyone, they don't need a Locker account to view it.
new_share.choose_items_note: You might choose as many as you want.
new_share.personal_email_or_group_placeholder: Enter email or group name to search

import_export.title: Import/Export
import_export.description: Manage your profile details and account preferences.
import_export.import_description: Transfer passwords and other items from browser or files.
import_export.export_description: Enter your master password to export your vault data.
import_export.upload_file: Upload a file from your computer
import_export.copy_paste_file_contents: or copy/paste the import file contents
import_export.incorrect_format: The data is not in the correct format

instructions.see_details: See detailed instructions on our help site at
instructions.keepassx: Using the KeePassX desktop application, navigate to "Database" → "Export to CSV file" and save the CSV file.
instructions.avira: In the Avira web vault, go to "Settings" → "My Data" → "Export data" and save the CSV file.
instructions.blur: In the Blur web vault, click your username at the top and go to "Settings" → "Export Data", then click "Export CSV" for your "Accounts".
instructions.safeincloud: Using the SaveInCloud desktop application, navigate to "File" → "Export" → "As XML" and save the XML file.
instructions.padlock: Using the Padlock desktop application, click the hamburger icon in the top left corner and navigate to "Settings" & rarr; "Export" button and save the file "As CSV".
instructions.keepass2: Using the KeePass 2 desktop application, navigate to "File" → "Export" and select the "KeePass XML (2.x)" option.
instructions.upm: Using the Universal Password Manager desktop application, navigate to "Database" → "Export" and save the CSV file.
instructions.saferpass: Using the SaferPass browser extension, click the hamburger icon in the top left corner and navigate to "Settings". Click the "Export accounts" button to save the CSV file.
instructions.medium: Using the Meldium web vault, navigate to "Settings". Locate the "Export data" function and click "Show me my data" to save the CSV file.
instructions.keeper: Log into the Keeper web vault (keepersecurity.com/vault). Navigate to "Backup" (top right) and find the "Export to .csv File" option.Click "Export Now" to save the CSV file.
instructions.passworddragon: Using the Password Dragon desktop application, navigate to "File" → "Export" → "To XML". In the dialog that pops up select "All Rows" and check all fields.Click the "Export" button and save the XML file.
instructions.enpass: Using the Enpass desktop application, navigate to "File" → "Export" → "As CSV". Select "OK" to thewarning alert and save the CSV file.Note that the importer only supports files exported while Enpass is set to the English language, so adjust your settings accordingly.
instructions.enpassjson: Using the Enpass 6 desktop application, click the menu button and navigate to "File" → "Export". Select the ".json" file format option and save the JSON file.
instructions.pwsafe: Using the Password Safe desktop application, navigate to "File" → "Export To" → "XML format..." and save the XML file.
instructions.dashlane: Using the Dashlane desktop application, navigate to "File" → "Export" → "Unsecured archive (readable) in JSON format" and save the JSON file.
instructions.msecure: Using the mSecure desktop application, navigate to "File" → "Export" → "CSV File..." and save the CSV file.
instructions.stickypassword: Using the Sticky Password desktop application, navigate to "Menu" (top right) → "Export" → "Export all". Select the unencrypted format XML option and save the XML file.
instructions.truekey: Using the True Key desktop application, click the gear icon (top right) and then navigate to "App Settings". Click the "Export" button, enter your password and save the CSV file.
instructions.clipperz: Log into the Clipperz web application (clipperz.is/app). Click the hamburger menu icon in the top right to expand the navigation bar.Navigate to "Data" & rarr; "Export".Click the "download HTML+JSON" button to save the HTML file.
instructions.roboform: Using the RoboForm Editor desktop application, navigate to "RoboForm" (top left) → "Options" → "Account & Data" and click the "Export" button.Select all of your data, change the "Format" to "CSV file" and then click the "Export" button to save the CSV file. Note: RoboForm only allows you to export Logins.Other items will not be exported.
instructions.passbolt: Log into the Passbolt web vault and navigate to the "Passwords" listing. Select all of the passwords you would like to export and click the " button at the top of the listing.Choose the "csv (lastpass)" export format and click the "Export" button.
instructions.ascendoc: Using the Ascendo DataVault desktop application, navigate to "Tools" → "Export". In the dialog that pops up, select the "All Items (DVX, CSV)" option.Click the "Ok" button to save the CSV file.
instructions.passwordboss: Using the Password Boss desktop application, navigate to "File" → "Export data" → "Password Boss JSON - not encrypted" and save the JSON file.
instructions.zohovault: Log into the Zoho web vault (vault.zoho.com). Navigate to "Tools" → "Export Secrets". Select "All Secrets" and click the "Zoho Vault Format CSV" button. Highlight and copy the data from the textarea. Open a text editor like Notepad and paste the data.Save the data from the text editor as zoho_export.csv.
instructions.splashid: Using the SplashID Safe desktop application, click on the SplashID blue lock logo in the top right corner. Navigate to "Export" & rarr; "Export as CSV" and save the CSV file.
instructions.passkeep: Using the PassKeep mobile app, navigate to "Backup/Restore". Locate the "CSV Backup/Restore" section and click "Backup to CSV" to save the CSV file.
instructions.passwordagent: Using the Password Agent desktop application navigate to "File" → "Export", select the "Fields to export " button and check all of the fields, change the "Output format" to "CSV", and then click the "Start" button to save the CSV file.
instructions.passpack: Log into the Passpack website vault and navigate to "Settings" → "Export", then click the "Download" button to save the CSV file.
instructions.passmanjson: Open your Passman vault and click on "Settings" in the bottom left corner. In the "Settings" window switch to the "Export credentials" tab and choose "JSON" as the export type.Enter your vault's passphrase and click the "Export" button to save the JSON file.
instructions.avastcsv: Open the Avast Passwords desktop application and navigate to "Settings" → "Import/export data". Select the "Export" button for the "Export to CSV file" option to save the CSV file.
instructions.avastjson: Open the Avast Passwords desktop application and navigate to "Settings" → "Import/export data". Select the "Export" button for the "Export to JSON file" option to save the JSON file.
instructions.fsecurefsk: Open the F-Secure KEY desktop application and navigate to "Settings" → "Export Passwords". Select the "Export" button, enter your master password, and save the FSK file.
instructions.kaspersky: Open the Kaspersky Password Manager desktop application and navigate to "Settings" → "Import/Export". Locate the "Export to text file" section and select the "Export" button to save the TXT file.
instructions.remembear: Open the RememBear desktop application and navigate to "Settings" → "Account" → "Export". Enter your master password and select the "Export Anyway" button to save the CSV file.
instructions.passwordwallet: Open the PasswordWallet desktop application and navigate to "File" → "Export" → "Visible entries to text file".Enter your password and select the "Ok" button to save the TXT file.
instructions.myki: Open the Myki desktop browser extension and navigate to "Advanced" → "Export Accounts" and then scan the QR code with your mobile device.Various CSV files will then be saved to your computer's downloads folder.
instructions.securesafe: Export your SecureSafe password safe to a CSV file with a comma delimiter.
instructions.logmeonce: Open the LogMeOnce browser extension, then navigate to "Open Menu" → "Export To" and select "CSV File" to save the CSV file.
instructions.blackberry: Open the BlackBerry Password Keeper application, then navigate to "Settings" → "Import/Export". Select "Export Passwords" and follow the instructions on screen to save the unencrypted CSV file.
instructions.buttercup: Open the Buttercup desktop application and unlock your vault. Right click on your vault's icon and select "Export" to save the CSV file.
instructions.codebook: Open the Codebook desktop application and log in. Navigate to "File" → "Export all", then click "Yes" on the dialog and save the CSV file.
instructions.encryptr: Open the newest version of the Encryptr desktop application and allow all of your data to sync. Once syncing of your data is complete, the download icon in the top right corner will turn pink.Click the download icon and save the CSV file.
instructions.yoti: From the Yoti browser extension, click on "Settings", then "Export Saved Logins" and save the CSV file.

change_password.title: Account Password
change_password.description: All Locker accounts are protected with AES-256 encryption and Zero Knowledge technology for better security and privacy, regardless of account plan.

change_master_password.title: Master Password
change_master_password.description: All Locker accounts are protected with AES-256 encryption and Zero Knowledge technology for better security and privacy, regardless of account plan.

two_fa.title: Two-factor authentication (2FA)
two_fa.description: Create an additional layer of security by setting up 2FA for your Locker account.

emergency_access.title: Emergency Access
emergency_access.description: This feature grants other Locker account owner(s) the ability to access to your vault in some emergency situations.
emergency_access.grantor_recovery_initiated_info: The user will be provided access after {{day}} day(s) or whenever you manually approve the request.
emergency_access.grantee_recovery_initiated_info: You will be provided access after {{day}} day(s) or whenever the user manually approves the request.
emergency_access.approve_question: Are you sure you want to approve emergency access? This will allow {{user}} to {{type}} your account.
emergency_access.delete_question: Are you sure you want to remove this emergency contact?
emergency_access.initiate_question: Are you sure you want to request emergency access? You will be provided access after {{day}} day(s) or whenever the user manually approves the request.

emergency_contact.view_description: They can view all your vault items
emergency_contact.takeover_description: They can reset your Master Password
emergency_contact.wait_time_description: Time required before automatically granting access.

manage_sessions.title: Manage sessions
manage_sessions.log_out_of_description: This will remove access to your Locker Account from the device. Enter Master Password to confirm.
manage_sessions.log_out_all_description: Concerned your account is logged in on another device? Proceed below to deauthorize all computers or devices that you have previously used. This security step is recommended if you previously used a public computer or accidentally saved your password on a device that isn't yours.
manage_sessions.log_out_all_note: Proceeding will also log you out of your current session, requiring you to log back in.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.item_no_longer_shared: This item is no longer shared

password_generate.title: Password Generate
password_generate.description: Create secure passwords for your accounts

password_health.title: Password Health
password_health.description: Identify passwords that can put you at risk
password_health.good_news_details: All items in your vault with passwords that are strong

weak_passwords.title: Weak passwords
weak_passwords.alert_description: We found {{count}} items in your vault with passwords that are not strong. You should update them to use stronger passwords.

reused_passwords.title: Reused passwords
reused_passwords.alert_description: We found {{count}} passwords that are being reused in your vault. You should change them to a unique value.

exposed_passwords.title: Exposed passwords
exposed_passwords.description: Exposed passwords are passwords that have been uncovered in known data breaches that were released publicly or sold on the dark web by hackers.
exposed_passwords.alert_description: We found {{count}} items in your vault that have passwords that were exposed in known data breaches. You should change them to use a new password.

data_breach_scanner.title: Data Breach Scanner
data_breach_scanner.description: Check if your sensitive data has been leaked online
data_breach_scanner.content_title: A "breach" is an incident where a site's data has been illegally accessed by hackers and then released publicly. Review the types of data that were compromised (email addresses, passwords, credit cards etc.) and take appropriate action, such as changing passwords.
data_breach_scanner.input_label: Check any usernames or email addresses that you use.
data_breach_scanner.breach_not_found_details: {{username}} was not found in any known data breaches.
data_breach_scanner.alert_description: {{username}} was found in {{different_count}} different data breaches online.
